body:
Coming from #14566, the smallest set of things I want when I have a vendor directory outside the GOPATH is:
1. have my vendor directory is managed like $GOPATH/src;
2. be able to specify the package name of my current directory.
This way, I can have my CI do reproductible builds using, for instance:
```
go build --local-package example.com/my-tools -o dist/my-command  ./cmd/my-command
```
Optionally, if `go get` can also pull to my vendor directory when outside of my GOPATH, that would be awesome.
